snippet: The Food and Drug Administration announced Monday that it had set new safety standards for infant formula.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration announces that it has set new safety standards for infant formula; rules require manufactures to screen products for salmonella and cronobacter, a potentially lethal germ.
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration announced Monday that it had set new safety standards for infant formula.

headline.main: New Safety Standards Set for Baby Food
headline.print_headline: New Safety Standards Set for Baby Food
